Boulders.Name: Boulder 1
Boulders.Description: This is the obvious large boulder.

Routes.Name: Boot Flake
Routes.Description: Start slightly to the right of the "boot". Gain a right hand crimp and make a big move to the boot. Carefully top out.

Routes.Name: Endo Boy
Routes.Description: This line climbs to the right of Boot Flake via sidepulls and crimps.

Routes.Name: Three Pigs
Routes.Description: Climb the pin scars on the east side of the boulder. Avoiding the scars is a grade or two harder.

Routes.Name: Undercling Problem
Routes.Description: Start at the flake and move into the undercling with slippery feet. Reach over the top for a chipped hold and top out.

Boulders.Name: Slant Rock
Boulders.Description: This boulder is a few yards to the southeast of Boulder 1 and has a low angle west face that is often ascended with no hands.

Boulders.Name: Pump Rock
Boulders.Description: This boulder lies just north of Boulder 1 and has a traverse around its lip

Routes.Name: Pump Traverse
Routes.Description: Stand start at the south-east corner and traverse the        lip of the bouler to the north-west corner and top out. The sit start at the south-east corner is V1 and the sit start at he south-west corner is V2.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb the north-east arete via a sit start.

Routes.Name: Unknown
Routes.Description: Ascend the face opposite the north face of Pump Rock via sloping crips.

Boulders.Name: Crank Queenie Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder is adjacent to the north of Pump Boulder and has a very overhanging north face through the cave.

Boulders.Name: Pile Ups Boulder
Boulders.Description: The obvious short boulder next to the trail.

Routes.Name: Pile Ups Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the lip of the boulder left-to-right.

Routes.Name: Pile Driver
Routes.Description: Start at the flake-jug thingy, make a big move up to a sloping crimp and top out via a dyno for the lip or static moves out left.

Routes.Name: Pile Driver Lieback
Routes.Description: Start matched on a good crimp, reach left for the lieback hold, pop for the sloping shelf and make a big move to top out at the apex of the boulder.

Routes.Name: Gomer Pile
Routes.Description: Ascend the face to the right of Pile Driver Lieback.

Routes.Name: Anderson Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the face on bad holds left to right starting at the starting hold of Pile Driver.

Boulders.Name: Teflon President Boulder
Boulders.Description: The big boulder with ther arete on the southwest side.

Routes.Name: Teflon President
Routes.Description: Climb the right arete.

Boulders.Name: Romeo Void
Boulders.Description: A large clump of boulders about 30 yards south of the trail. You see an obvoius crack/chute when approaching it.

Routes.Name: Mr. Ed
Routes.Description: Climb the lieback crack on the north face. Often toproped.

Boulders.Name: Holy Water Boulder
Boulders.Description: This small boulder is located somewhat by itself before you reach the main part of the Main Area. It is to the left of the trail, directly bordering the trail.

Routes.Name: In the Name of the Father
Routes.Description: Climb the obvious large pockets facing the trail in the direction to the campground. Top out on large flakes.

Routes.Name: And the Son
Routes.Description: From a sit start on the trail climb up straight on several horizontal cracks.

Routes.Name: And the Holy Spirit, Amen
Routes.Description: On the side facing the trail, sit start on crips, climb to the large pocket and top out.

Boulders.Name: B1 Boulder
Boulders.Description: The obvious chalked boulder right next to the trail.

Routes.Name: B1 Traverse
Routes.Description: Start on a set of plates on the right side of the boulder, traverse along the lip to the patina plates on the left and climb along the pates to the top.

Routes.Name: Thin Face
Routes.Description: Climb a series of nice crimps with the smallest one just before the top.

Boulders.Name: Blank Generation Boulder
Boulders.Description: The large squat boulder behind the B1 boulder

Routes.Name: Freeway Traverse
Routes.Description: Traverse the lip of the boulder starting on the downhill corner across from Sword of Damocles

Routes.Name: The Wave
Routes.Description: Start low and right, climb the face then reach for a jug at the lip of the roof and mantle over. A good spot rpotects from the rock behind you.

Routes.Name: Blank Generation
Routes.Description: Start on bad crimps on glued-on flake, then boost out huge to high crimps, hit the lip and top-out. The sit start is V10.

Boulders.Name: Alfa Boulder
Boulders.Description: The first boulder on the right after the Holy Water boulder with an overhanging prow.

Routes.Name: Unknown
Routes.Description: Sit start on crimps and climb over the roof/prow.

Boulders.Name: Arbor Day Boulder
Boulders.Description: The large boulder just up the trail from the Alfa Boulder

Routes.Name: Better Bold than Old
Routes.Description: Start sitting, on the lowest holds possible with a good left foot and go up and slightly left at first then straight up finishing with good holds and the lip. Amazing rock quality and good movement.

Routes.Name: Arbor Days
Routes.Description: tart on the obvious holds at face height and go up and slightly left on good crimps.

Boulders.Name: Eriksson Boulder
Boulders.Description: Across form the Sword of Damocles Boulder

Routes.Name: Eriksson Problem
Routes.Description: Climb crystals and tiny crimps up the tallish face facing Sword of Damocles.

Boulders.Name: Orange Flambe Boulder
Boulders.Description: In between the refrigerator and the fang, the large orange boulder perched on the granite slab.

Routes.Name: Orange Flambe
Routes.Description: Start hugging the Orange Patina with a good right hand sidepull and mediocre left hand sidepull. Use technique and a bit of wizardry to climb up and slightly right on holds you wish were better. A Horse Flats classic.

Boulders.Name: Swiss Cheese Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder right next to the trail with the overhanging huecoed downhill face.

Routes.Name: Swiss Cheese
Routes.Description: Climb the overhanging huecoed face on the downhill side of the boulder. The original finish stays left, but it is slightly easier to finish right, although the landing is worse.

Boulders.Name: Boulder
Boulders.Description: This boulder sits across the trail and just uphill from the Swiss Cheese Boulder. It has a slabby face facing the trail and a clean vertical face on the left side.

Routes.Name: Heady Topper
Routes.Description: Located on the slabby side of the boulder facing the trail. Mantle onto the knob then acsend the tall slab above.

Routes.Name: Unknown
Routes.Description: Climb the right side of the clean vertical face on positive crimps and knobs. Beautiful rock.

Routes.Name: Nob Wall
Routes.Description: Climb the center of the clean vertical face on smaller holds.

Boulders.Name: The Faclon Boulder
Boulders.Description: A short boulder just to the east of Blank Generation.

Routes.Name: The Falcon
Routes.Description: Start on low rail, heel-hook and go for a hold out right, reach up for the sidepull and try to top out. Short but burly

Boulders.Name: Thin Crack Boulder
Boulders.Description: A tall boulder with an obvious crack, slightly off the trail to the left of the B1 Traverse boulder.

Routes.Name: Thin Crack
Routes.Description: The obvious crack visible from the trail

Boulders.Name: Barndoor Arete Boulder
Boulders.Description: Boulder with the obvious arete between the Fang and The Great Circle

Routes.Name: Barndoor Arete
Routes.Description: Ascend the obvious technical arete to better holds

Boulders.Name: Sword of Damocles Boulder
Boulders.Description: A tall boulder with an overhanging arete on the downhill side, in the middle of the main area, to the left of the Eriksson problem, looking uphill.

Routes.Name: Sword of Damocles
Routes.Description: Climb the improbable-looking tall arete on the right side of the downhill face. One of the best problems in Southern California.

Boulders.Name: Golf Boulder
Boulders.Description: Boulder just uphill from Sword of Damocles

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb the arete on sharp holds.

Routes.Name: The Hotel
Routes.Description: Start with both hands matched on the underclings, make some moves up and right to crimps and slopes.

Boulders.Name: The Fang Boulder
Boulders.Description: A boulder with a severly overhanging huecoed face just off the trail to the right just past the 5.7 Crack.

Routes.Name: The Fang
Routes.Description: Start under the roof and climb the fang. The sit start is V5.

Routes.Name: Zack's Roof
Routes.Description: Start as for The Fang, but climb the huecos out right.

Boulders.Name: Victor Boulder
Boulders.Description: A boulder between the B1 Boulder and The Great Curve with a steep clab facing the trail.

Routes.Name: Arete
Routes.Description: Climb the chunky arete on the downhill side of the boulder. Bad landing.

Routes.Name: Slab
Routes.Description: Climb the slab without using the arete, slightly harder to the left.

Boulders.Name: Great Curve Boulder
Boulders.Description: The big boulder with a blunt arete on the left, about 30 yards left of the B1 boulder.

Routes.Name: The Great Curve
Routes.Description: Jump start to a pinch on the blunt left arete, and climb the arete to a sketchy top out.

Boulders.Name: Peanut Boulder
Boulders.Description: The boulder is straight downhill from the obvious Y-Crack past the Skin Boulder. It is visible from the trail.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: On the undercut face facing Mr Skin, climb the pockets.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: On the left side of the boulder, when facing the boulder from the main trail, start near a small, sharp tree stump. The true sit start is perhaps v4.

Routes.Name: Nothing But Sunshine
Routes.Description: Start both hands in the diagonal jug, go right hand up to the crimp, then traverse left on crimps and pinches to a big throw to a good crimp out left and up to good patina up top. One of the best at The Flats.

Routes.Name: The Peanut
Routes.Description: Start in the same diagonal jug as NBS, but instead go left hand up to the crimp, then right hand to a slick side pull and a big crux throw up left to patina.

Routes.Name: Daddy Long Legs
Routes.Description: Right of the Peanut, in the center of the face, start on two good crimps and climb straight up.

Routes.Name: Unnamed
Routes.Description: Climb patina crimps on the right side of the face away from the trail.

Boulders.Name: Dragon Rock
Boulders.Description: Beautiful, secluded, 35'+ southern exposed granite boulder.

Routes.Name: Dragon Flake
Routes.Description: Start just right of Dragon Flake, go straight up to the finish.

Routes.Name: Dragon Flake Cheater Variation
Routes.Description: Follow the flake up and right and around the arete.
